question: 1. What does CSS stand for?
2. Which CSS property is used to change the text color of an element?
3. True or False: Inline styles have the highest specificity in CSS.
4. What is the purpose of the 'box-sizing' property in CSS?
options: Specifies the width and height of an element
Specifies how the padding and border are calculated
Specifies the position of an element
Specifies the display behavior of an element

question: 5. Which CSS selector is used to select all elements with a specific class?
6. True or False: The 'position: relative;' CSS property positions an element relative to its normal position.
7. What is the CSS property used for controlling the overflow of content in a box?
8. How can you center align a block-level element in CSS?
9. True or False: CSS Grid is a one-dimensional layout system.
10. Which CSS property is used to add shadows to text?
11. What does the 'z-index' property in CSS control?
options: The vertical stacking order of elements

question: 12. True or False: CSS Grid is primarily designed for two-dimensional layouts.
13. What is the purpose of the 'clear' property in CSS?
options: To clear the background of an element
To clear the float property of an element
To clear the font styling of an element
To clear the margin of an element

question: 14. Which CSS property is used for changing the spacing between lines of text?
15. True or False: The 'em' unit in CSS is relative to the font-size of the closest parent element.
16. What is the purpose of the 'transform' property in CSS?
options: To apply 3D effects to an element
To rotate, scale, or skew an element
To convert colors in an element

question: 17. How can you include external CSS in an HTML document?
18. True or False: CSS Flexbox is mainly designed for one-dimensional layouts.
19. What does the CSS property 'opacity' control?
20. Which CSS pseudo-class selects the first child element of its parent?
21. Which of the following CSS properties is used to set the text color?
22. True or False: CSS variables are also known as custom properties.
23. What does the 'box-sizing' property in CSS control?
options: The size of the text box
The sizing of an element's box model

question: 24. How can you center an element horizontally in CSS?
25. What does the 'transition' property in CSS do?
options: Creates a smooth transition effect for an element's property changes
Moves an element from left to right
Changes the font of an element
Applies a transition color to an element

question: 26. True or False: The 'position: absolute;' property removes an element from the normal document flow.
27. What is the purpose of the CSS property 'display: inline-block;'?
options: To display an element as an inline-level block container
To hide an element from the display
To display an element as a block-level inline container
To make an element's text bold

question: 28. Which CSS property is used to add shadows to an element?
29. How can you select all links inside a div with the class 'container' using CSS?
30. True or False: The 'line-break' property in CSS is used to control where a line will break.
31. What does the 'Z-index' property in CSS control?
options: The vertical position of an element
The horizontal position of an element
The zoom level of an element

question: 32. How can you make a list of horizontal navigation items using CSS?
33. True or False: The 'rgba()' value in CSS is used to define a color using red, green, blue, and alpha (transparency) values.
34. What is the purpose of the 'max-width' property in CSS?
options: To set the maximum height of an element
To set the maximum width of an element
To set the minimum width of an element
To set the minimum height of an element

question: 35. Which CSS property is used to control the space between the border and the content of an element?
36. How can you apply a background image to an element in CSS?
37. True or False: The 'em' unit in CSS is relative to the font-size of the closest parent element.
38. What is the purpose of the 'clear' property in CSS?
options: To set the transparency of an element
To clear floated elements and force an element to be placed below them
To set the color of text
To clear the text of an element

question: 39. Which CSS pseudo-class is used to select and style the first child element of another element?
40. True or False: The 'transform' property in CSS is used to rotate, scale, or skew an element.
41. What does the CSS property 'box-sizing: border-box;' do?
options: Includes padding and border in the element's total width and height
Excludes padding and border from the element's total width and height
Applies a border to the box
Increases the width and height of the box

question: 42. True or False: The 'transition' property in CSS is used to create smooth transitions between different property values.
43. In CSS, what does the 'nth-child()' pseudo-class selector do?
options: Selects all elements that are the nth child of their parent
Selects only the first child of an element
Selects elements based on their text content
Selects the last child of an element

question: 44. How can you center an element horizontally in CSS?
45. What is the purpose of the CSS property 'opacity'?
options: Controls the transparency of an element
Sets the color of an element
Defines the space between the border and content
Adjusts the size of an element

question: 46. True or False: The 'position: fixed;' property in CSS positions an element relative to its closest positioned ancestor.
47. What does the CSS property 'word-wrap' control?
options: Wraps text to the next line if it's too long to fit within the container
Changes the font style of text
Prevents text from wrapping to the next line

question: 48. How can you create a responsive design in CSS?
49. True or False: The 'display: none;' property in CSS hides an element, and the space it occupies is still reserved.
50. What is the purpose of the CSS 'content' property?
options: Sets the content of an element using text or a URL
Specifies the content that should be inserted before or after an element
Defines the content of a pseudo-element
Controls the visibility of an element

question: 51. In CSS, what does the 'overflow: hidden;' property do?
options: Hides the overflow content of an element
Displays the overflow content outside the element
Adds a hidden scrollbar to the element
Expands the element to fit its content

question: 52. True or False: The 'flex-direction' property in CSS determines the direction of the flexible items in a flex container.
53. What is the purpose of the 'cursor' property in CSS?
options: Sets the color of the mouse cursor
Changes the shape of the mouse cursor
Defines the speed of the mouse cursor

question: 54. How can you style alternate rows of a table differently in CSS?
55. True or False: The 'rem' unit in CSS is relative to the root element's font size.
56. What does the CSS property 'text-transform: uppercase;' do?
options: Transforms the text to title case
Transforms the text to sentence case

question: 57. How can you make a CSS class that is only applied when printing a page?
58. True or False: The 'border-collapse' property in CSS is used to separate the borders of table cells.
59. What is the purpose of the 'translate()' function in CSS?
options: Changes the color of an element
Moves the element along the X and Y axis

question: 60. Which CSS property is used to control the spacing between individual characters in a text?
61. What is the purpose of the CSS property 'z-index'?
options: Controls the order of stacking elements along the z-axis
Sets the width of an element
Defines the space between inline elements
Specifies the height of an element

question: 62. True or False: The 'currentColor' keyword in CSS refers to the current background color of an element.
63. What does the CSS property 'pointer-events: none;' do?
options: Disables the pointer events for an element
Enables pointer events for an element

question: 64. How can you create a CSS animation?
options: Applying the 'animate' class to an element
Setting the 'animate' property in the style attribute

question: 65. True or False: The 'max-width' property in CSS sets the maximum width of an element.
66. In CSS, what does the 'visibility: hidden;' property do?
options: Hides an element, and the space it occupies is still reserved
Hides an element, and the space it occupies collapses
Changes the opacity of an element

question: 67. What is the purpose of the CSS pseudo-element '::before'?
options: Selects the element before the specified element
Selects the first child of an element
Inserts content before the content of the selected element

question: 68. How can you vertically align text in CSS?
69. True or False: The 'outline' property in CSS is used to set the thickness and style of the outline of an element.
70. What is the CSS property 'flex-grow' used for?
options: Specifies the initial size of a flex container
Controls the size of flex items along the main axis
Defines the ability for a flex item to grow
Sets the order of a flex item

question: 71. In CSS, what is the 'backface-visibility' property used for?
options: Controls the visibility of the back face of an element
Specifies the visibility of the front face of an element
Defines the visibility of child elements
Sets the visibility of the element's border

question: 72. True or False: The 'clip-path' property in CSS is used to define the visible area of an element.
73. What is the purpose of the CSS property 'object-fit'?
options: Defines how an element's content should be resized to fit its container
Sets the size of an object in pixels
Controls the alignment of inline elements
Adjusts the opacity of an element

question: 74. How can you style a hyperlink that is being hovered over in CSS?
75. True or False: The 'filter' property in CSS is used to apply graphical effects like blur or color adjustment to an element.
76. What does the CSS property 'justify-content' do?
options: Aligns the items inside a flexible container
Justifies the content of a block element
Adjusts the spacing between lines of text

question: 77. In CSS, what is the 'currentColor' keyword used for?
options: Refers to the current font color of an element
Sets the background color of an element
Specifies the current color of the viewport
Matches the color of the element on which it's used

question: 78. How can you add a shadow to text in CSS?
79. True or False: The 'white-space' property in CSS controls the visibility of white spaces in an element.
80. What is the purpose of the CSS property 'mix-blend-mode'?
options: Defines the blending mode between an element and its background
Mixes the colors of adjacent elements
Blends the content of two elements
Sets the opacity of an element

question: 81. How can you hide an element visually but keep it accessible to screen readers?
82. True or False: The 'line-height' property in CSS is used to set the spacing between lines of text.
83. What does the CSS property 'box-decoration-break' control?
options: Specifies the style of the box's border
Breaks the box's content, padding, and border individually
Changes the order of the box model
Defines the space between inline elements

question: 84. How can you create a gradient background in CSS?
85. In CSS, what does the 'font-weight' property control?
options: Sets the thickness of the text characters
Defines the style of the font
Specifies the size of the font
Controls the boldness of the font

question: 86. True or False: The 'content-visibility' property in CSS is used to control when an element's content is rendered.
87. What is the CSS property 'column-count' used for?
options: Sets the number of columns an element should be divided into
Counts the number of columns in a table
Specifies the width of columns in a grid layout

question: 88. How can you create a responsive navigation menu in CSS?
options: Applying media queries to hide the navigation on small screens
Using inline styles for navigation items

question: 89. True or False: The 'currentColor' keyword in CSS refers to the current font color of an element.
90. What does the CSS property 'text-overflow' control?
options: Adjusts the spacing between lines of text
Truncates text that is too long to fit within an element
Defines the visibility of white spaces
Specifies the style of the text

question: 91. In CSS, what is the 'visibility' property used for?
options: Specifies whether an element is visible or hidden
Controls the opacity of an element
Sets the visibility of child elements
Hides an element but keeps the space it occupies

question: 92. True or False: The 'transition' property in CSS is used to create smooth transitions between different property values.
93. How can you select all paragraphs with a class of 'intro' in CSS?
94. What is the purpose of the 'pointer-events' property in CSS?
options: Specifies the size of the mouse pointer
Determines the color of the mouse pointer
Controls whether an element can be the target for user events
Sets the speed of the mouse pointer

question: 95. True or False: The 'justify-content' property in CSS aligns the items inside a flexible container.
96. What is the purpose of the 'will-change' property in CSS?
options: Specifies the color of the element
Hints to the browser that an element is likely to change
Sets the duration of an animation
Controls the visibility of an element

question: 97. How can you add rounded corners to an element in CSS?
98. True or False: The 'currentColor' keyword in CSS refers to the current text color of an element.
99. What does the CSS property 'object-position' control?
options: Defines the position of a replaced element's content
Sets the position of a flex container
Specifies the alignment of inline elements

question: 100. How can you select the first child element of a parent in CSS?
